intro: Thesium humile, commonly known as the dwarf thesium, is a small, flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Thesium humile is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions.
